meanings.definition: The exclusive possession or control of the supply or trade in a commodity or service.
meanings.sent1: Some people believe that monopolies can limit choices for consumers.
meanings.sent2: The government intervened to break up the monopolies in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The monopolies in the town made it hard for new businesses to thrive.
meanings.sent4: Her monopoly over the lemonade stand was unchallenged by the other kids.
meanings.sent5: The monopolies in the market cornered all the customers with their high prices.

meanings.definition: A company or group having exclusive control over a commercial activity.
meanings.sent1: The tech giant established a monopoly in the smartphone industry.
meanings.sent2: Monopolies can sometimes stifle innovation and competition.
meanings.sent3: The monopoly over the cookie business made him the king of sweets.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a monopoly in the office with her unique skills.
meanings.sent5: The monopoly over the ice cream shop attracted long lines of customers.
